card.name: Acidic Sliver
card.ability: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: This permanent deals 2 damage to target creature or player."
card.flavor: The first sliver burst against the cave wall, and others piled in behind to deepen the new tunnel.
card.ruling: \n7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit. \n7/1/2013 : If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

card.name: Aftershock
card.ability: Destroy target artifact, creature, or land. Aftershock deals 3 damage to you.
card.flavor:
"Every act of destruction has a repercussion."
—Karn, silver golem

card.name: Aluren
card.ability: Any player may play creature cards with converted mana cost 3 or less without paying their mana cost and as though they had flash.
card.flavor:
Squee bounced up and down. "I sees a horsey, an' a piggy, an' a—"
"If you don't shut up," hissed Mirri, "you'll see a kidney and a spleeny."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The mana cost of the creatures being cast is still the stated cost on the card, even though you did not pay the cost. 
10/4/2004 : Aluren checks the actual printed cost on the creature card, and is not affected by things which allow you to cast the spell for less. 
10/4/2004 : You can't choose to cast a creature as though it had flash via Aluren and still pay the mana cost. You either cast the creature normally, or via Aluren without paying the mana cost. 
10/4/2004 : You can't use Aluren when casting a creature using another alternate means, such as the Morph ability. 
8/1/2008 : If creature with X in its cost is cast this way, X can only be 0.

card.name: Anarchist
card.ability: When Anarchist enters the battlefield, you may return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: "I'll take that. You won't need it when the revolution comes."

card.name: Angelic Blessing
card.ability: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.

card.name: Angelic Protector
card.ability: Flying\nWhenever Angelic Protector becomes the target of a spell or ability, Angelic Protector gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"My family sheltered in her light, the dark was content to wait."
—Crovax
card.ruling: \n10/1/2009 : The ability triggers when Angelic Protector is chosen as a target for a spell or ability. The Protectors ability will be put on the stack above that spell or ability, and so resolve first.

card.name: Anoint
card.ability: Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nPrevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

card.name: Armor Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures have "{2}: This creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn."
card.flavor:
Hanna: "We must learn how they protect each other."
Mirri: "After they're done trying to kill us, all right?"
card.ruling: \n7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit. \n7/1/2013 : If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

card.name: Armored Pegasus
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor:
"I always charge a little extra to take on a pegasus. They fly like eagles, kick like mules, and hide like hermits."
—Tahli en-Dal, bounty hunter

card.name: Avenging Angel
card.ability: Flying\nWhen Avenging Angel dies, you may put it on top of its owner's library.
card.ruling: \n4/1/2008 : This has been restored as a triggered ability that triggers when it is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, rather than a replacement effect. The Angel does go to the graveyard, and will trigger any other abilities that look for this event.

card.name: Bandage
card.ability: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.\nDraw a card.
card.flavor: Takara shook with guilt. She knew the last image her father had seen was her sword flashing toward him.
card.ruling: \n7/15/2007 : You draw the card when Bandage resolves, not when the damage is actually prevented.

card.name: Barbed Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures have "{2}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
card.flavor: Spans of spines leapt from one sliver to the next, forming a deadly hedge around the Weatherlight.
card.ruling: \n7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit. \n7/1/2013 : If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

card.name: Bottle Gnomes
card.ability: Sacrifice Bottle Gnomes: You gain 3 life.
card.flavor:
"I am reminded of the fable of the silver egg. Its owner cracks it open to see what jewels it holds, only to discover a simple yellow yolk."
—Karn, silver golem

card.name: Caldera Lake
card.ability: Caldera Lake enters the battlefield tapped.\n{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool. Caldera Lake deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Cannibalize
card.ability: Choose two target creatures controlled by the same player. Exile one of those creatures and put two +1/+1 counters on the other.
card.flavor: "Mine."
card.ruling: \n5/1/2008 : You choose the two target creatures during announcement. You choose which gets the counters and which is to get exiled on resolution.

card.name: Canopy Spider
card.ability: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor:
"We know our place in the cycle of life—and it is not as flies."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
card.ruling: \n4/1/2008 : This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

card.name: Canyon Wildcat
card.ability: Mountainwalk
card.flavor: "Relative of yours?" Ertai teased. Mirri simply sneered.

card.name: Capsize
card.ability: Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nReturn target permanent to its owner's hand.

card.name: Carnassid
card.ability: Trample\n{1}{G}: Regenerate Carnassid.
card.flavor: The hunter would never forget the time or place where he first met the carnassid, for they buried him there.

card.name: Carnophage
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, tap Carnophage unless you pay 1 life.
card.flavor: Eating is all it knows.

card.name: Cataclysm
card.ability: Each player chooses from among the permanents he or she controls an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a land, then sacrifices the rest.
card.flavor: The Weatherlight dragged the Predator behind it, the cradle hauling the casket.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you control a permanent with more than one type, you can choose that same permanent for more than one of the choices if you want to. This makes it possible to select an artifact creature as both your artifact and creature, and then select a land and thereby keep only two cards. 
10/4/2004 : If you control a permanent with more than one type, you can choose that permanent to be the representative of either type. This makes it possible to have more than one creature (or other permanent type) on the battlefield. For example, if you select a creature for your creature and an artifact creature for your artifact, you get to keep both of these creatures. 
10/4/2004 : The permanents to save are chosen on resolution. You do not choose them when casting the spell. 
10/4/2004 : The current player makes their choices before the other player. After both players make choices, all the sacrifices are done simultaneously. 
2/1/2014 : Each permanent not chosen by a player will be sacrificed. If a permanent has none of the listed types (for example, a Planeswalker with no other types), it can't be chosen.

card.name: Charging Paladin
card.ability: Whenever Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Hope shall be the blade that severs our bonds."

card.name: Cinder Marsh
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool. Cinder Marsh doesn't untap during your next untap step.

card.name: City of Traitors
card.ability: When you play another land, sacrifice City of Traitors.\n{T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"While we fought, the il surrendered."
—Oracle en-Vec
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : City of Traitors does not trigger on lands that are put onto the battlefield without playing them. \n10/4/2004 : City of Traitors does not trigger on itself being played.

card.name: Clot Sliver
card.ability: All Slivers have "{2}: Regenerate this permanent."
card.flavor:
"One would think I would be accustomed to unexpected returns."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator
card.ruling: \n7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit. \n7/1/2013 : If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

card.name: Coat of Arms
card.ability: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)
card.flavor:
"Hup, two, three, four,
Dunno how to count no more."
—Mogg march
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If a creature has more than one creature type, and one of those types matches the creature you are calculating for, then count that creature. Only one type needs to match in order to get counted. 
10/4/2004 : If you have a creature with more than one creature type, count all creatures which have either creature type. 
10/1/2009 : Sharing multiple creature types doesn't give an additional bonus. Coat of Arms counts creatures, not creature types.

card.name: Coercion
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
card.flavor:
"There's very little that escapes me, Greven. And you will escape very little if you fail."
—Volrath

card.name: Coffin Queen
card.ability: You may choose not to untap Coffin Queen during your untap step.\n{2}{B}, {T}: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. When Coffin Queen becomes untapped or you lose control of Coffin Queen, exile that creature.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the creature put onto the battlefield leaves the battlefield, the tracking effect ends and the creature will no longer be exiled if something happens to the Coffin Queen. 
10/4/2004 : If the creature put onto the battlefield phases out, the tracking effect continues when it phases back in if the Coffin Queen is still on the battlefield. If the Queen left the battlefield while the creature was phased out, the creature phases in as normal. 
2/1/2014 : If Coffin Queen leaves the battlefield before its ability resolves, the delayed trigger condition can never be fulfilled, so the creature will not be exiled. If Coffin Queen is untapped when its ability resolves, the creature will not be exiled until the next time Coffin Queen becomes untapped.

card.name: Coiled Tinviper
card.ability: First strike
card.flavor: The bite of the tinviper feels most like a razor drawn across the tongue.

card.name: Commander Greven il-Vec
card.ability: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)\nWhen Commander Greven il-Vec enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
card.flavor: "Rage is the only freedom left to me."

card.name: Conviction
card.ability: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +1/+3.\n{W}: Return Conviction to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: It was not the minotaur's shoulders but his soul that bore the heaviest weight.

card.name: Corpse Dance
card.ability: Buyback {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nReturn the top creature card of your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains haste until end of turn. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : Corpse Dance only exiles the card if the card is still on the battlefield at the beginning of the end step. \n4/1/2008 : The effect only grants Haste until the end of the current turn. If the creature somehow manages to stick around until a later turn, it will no longer have Haste.

card.name: Counterspell
card.ability: Counter target spell.
card.flavor:
"It was probably a lousy spell in the first place."
—Ertai, wizard adept

card.name: Crashing Boars
card.ability: Whenever Crashing Boars attacks, defending player chooses an untapped creature he or she controls. That creature blocks Crashing Boars this turn if able.
card.flavor: Bores ruin a party. Boars are party to ruin.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : If the chosen creature is not still untapped at the time blockers are declared, it does not have to block. \n10/4/2004 : The ability is not optional. If there are no untapped creatures to choose, then the ability does nothing.

card.name: Craven Giant
card.ability: Craven Giant can't block.
card.flavor:
What is high as a mountain and low as a snake?
—Dal riddle

card.name: Crovax the Cursed
card.ability: Crovax the Cursed enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice a creature. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Crovax. If you don't, remove a +1/+1 counter from Crovax.\n{B}: Crovax gains flying until end of turn.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Crovax can sacrifice itself to its upkeep triggered ability. 
10/4/2004 : You can only sacrifice one creature to it each turn. 
10/4/2004 : If you choose not to sacrifice a creature and he has no +1/+1 counters, then nothing bad happens. Note that some other effect must be keeping him alive if he has no counters.

card.name: Crystalline Sliver
card.ability: All Slivers have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor: Bred as living shields, these slivers have proven unruly—they know they cannot be caught.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability only applies while this card is on the battlefield. 
7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit. 
7/1/2013 : If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

card.name: Curiosity
card.ability: Enchant creature\nWhenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.
card.flavor: All Mirri wanted to do was rest, but she couldn't ignore a nagging suspicion as she followed Crovax's skulking form.
card.ruling:
2/1/2007 : You draw one card each time the enchanted creature damages the opponent. This is not one card per point of damage. 
2/1/2007 : If put on your opponent's creature, you do not draw a card when that creature damages you. The creature has to damage your opponent in order to have this work. 
2/1/2007 : Drawing a card is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later and do it, even if it is something you normally do. 
9/22/2011 : "You" refers to the controller of Curiosity, which may be different from the controller of the enchanted creature."An opponent" refers to an opponent of Curiosity's controller. 
9/22/2011 : Any damage dealt by the enchanted creature to an opponent will cause Curiosity to trigger, not just combat damage. 
9/22/2011 : Curiosity doesn't trigger if the enchanted creature deals damage to a planeswalker controlled by an opponent.

card.name: Cursed Flesh
card.ability: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets -1/-1 and has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.flavor: A farewell to arms . . . and feet . . . and legs . . .

card.name: Cursed Scroll
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Name a card. Reveal a card at random from your hand. If it's the named card, Cursed Scroll deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.ruling: \n8/1/2008 : If you have no cards in hand, you still have to name a card. Then you fail to reveal one (since there aren't any). Since the named card wasn't revealed, no damage is dealt.

card.name: Dark Banishing
card.ability: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"It is the way of most wizards to begin by exiling themselves and to end by exiling everyone else."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

card.name: Dark Ritual
card.ability: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"If there is such a thing as too much power, I have not discovered it."
—Volrath

card.name: Dauthi Horror
card.ability: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\nDauthi Horror can't be blocked by white creatures.

card.name: Dauthi Jackal
card.ability: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\n{B}{B}, Sacrifice Dauthi Jackal: Destroy target blocking creature.
card.flavor:
"All dauthi are jackals, regardless of breed."
—Lyna, soltari emissary
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : This creature does not have to be an attacker or blocker to use its ability.

card.name: Dauthi Marauder
card.ability: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
card.flavor:
"The dauthi came from beneath the ruins one night, and the darkness cast them in the best possible light."
—Soltari Tales of Life

card.name: Dauthi Slayer
card.ability: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\nDauthi Slayer attacks each turn if able.
card.flavor:
"They have knives for every soul."
—Lyna, soltari emissary

card.name: Dauthi Warlord
card.ability: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\nDauthi Warlord's power is equal to the number of creatures with shadow on the battlefield.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : Dauthi Warlord counts creatures with the Shadow ability controlled by all players.

card.name: Deadshot
card.ability: Tap target creature. It deals damage equal to its power to another target creature.
card.flavor:
"Carrion! Keep your distance. My blade will come to you!"
—Crovax
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : Deadshot can target a creature which is already tapped as its first target, and it will still damage the second target. This is because it taps that creature as an effect, not as a cost.

card.name: Death Pits of Rath
card.ability: Whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: As the sludge below began to shift and take shapes, Gerrard turned from the railing to Orim. "I suppose," he said, "it's a little too late for prayer, isn't it?"

card.name: Death Stroke
card.ability: Destroy target tapped creature.
card.flavor: For a sharp second, Selenia froze, and Crovax's blade found home. As the angel shattered like glass, Crovax felt his mind collapse—the curse had been fulfilled.

card.name: Death's Duet
card.ability: Return two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Life has always been a dance. It is only fitting that death sing the tune.

card.name: Diabolic Edict
card.ability: Target player sacrifices a creature.
card.flavor: Greven il-Vec lifted Vhati off his feet. "The fall will give you time to think on your failure."

card.name: Disenchant
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor: The swarm seemed unmoved by the artificial slivers' destruction. "They clearly were not the leaders," Hanna cursed. "I guess we'll have to do this the hard way."
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

card.name: Dismiss
card.ability: Counter target spell.\nDraw a card.
card.flavor:
"There is nothing you can do that I cannot simply deny."
—Ertai, wizard adept

card.name: Dracoplasm
card.ability: Flying\nAs Dracoplasm enters the battlefield, sacrifice any number of creatures. Dracoplasm's power becomes the total power of those creatures and its toughness becomes their total toughness.\n{R}: Dracoplasm gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Dream Halls
card.ability: Rather than pay the mana cost for a spell, its controller may discard a card that shares a color with that spell.
card.flavor: Within without.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : This only replaces the mana cost (the mana in the upper right hand corner of the card). It will not pay additional costs from the card text (such as Buyback) or from other effects. It does not prevent you from paying those additional costs if you want or need to.

card.name: Dream Prowler
card.ability: Dream Prowler can't be blocked as long as it's attacking alone.
card.flavor:
"To think that some find sleep a restful state."
—Volrath

card.name: Dungeon Shade
card.ability: Flying\n{B}: Dungeon Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: A sickness stirs in its eyes, a nightmare born in darkened wails.

card.name: Elven Rite
card.ability: Distribute two +1/+1 counters among one or two target creatures.
card.flavor: As the bough stretches, so shall you grow. As the roots spread, so shall you thrive.

card.name: Elvish Fury
card.ability: Buyback {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nTarget creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

card.name: Emmessi Tome
card.ability: {5}, {T}: Draw two cards, then discard a card.
card.flavor: It is like life and destiny: we think we know the story, but we have read only half the tale.

card.name: Endangered Armodon
card.ability: When you control a creature with toughness 2 or less, sacrifice Endangered Armodon.
card.flavor: These are its last days. It is doomed to be remembered only until the hunters hunger again.

card.name: Ephemeron
card.ability: Flying\nDiscard a card: Return Ephemeron to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: From nothing came teeth.

card.name: Erratic Portal
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Return target creature to its owner's hand unless its controller pays {1}.
card.flavor: "In Barrin's name!" cried Lyna as Hanna's sword passed through her, "Ertai sends word that the portal is open—but not for long!"

card.name: Evincar's Justice
card.ability: Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nEvincar's Justice deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.

card.name: Exalted Dragon
card.ability: Flying\nExalted Dragon can't attack unless you sacrifice a land. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)
card.flavor: If dragons excel at anything more than vanity, it is greed.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : You have to sacrifice a land at the time you declare this creature as an attacker if you want it to attack. This is additive with any other attack costs.

card.name: Fanning the Flames
card.ability: Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nFanning the Flames deals X damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Field of Souls
card.ability: Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : If you have two of these on the battlefield, both will trigger when a non-token creature goes to the graveyard. \n10/4/2004 : This only triggers on creatures going to the graveyard from the battlefield.

card.name: Fighting Drake
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Two things are needed to survive the harsh skies of Rath: a thick hide and a thicker skull.

card.name: Flame Wave
card.ability: Flame Wave deals 4 damage to target player and each creature he or she controls.
card.flavor:
"I hear the roaring of a wave whose waters are red and whose mists are black."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Flowstone Blade
card.ability: Enchant creature\n{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Remember the fable of the elf who came upon a cave of gold. In trying to free the largest piece, she was crushed by its weight."
—Karn, silver golem

card.name: Flowstone Mauler
card.ability: Trample\n{R}: Flowstone Mauler gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Once these horrifying creatures were perfected, there was no need for armodons.

card.name: Flowstone Wyvern
card.ability: Flying\n{R}: Flowstone Wyvern gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Where I come from, stone stays on the ground."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

card.name: Forbid
card.ability: Buyback—Discard two cards. (You may discard two cards in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nCounter target spell.

card.name: Fugue
card.ability: Target player discards three cards.
card.flavor: "My ship . . . ," Sisay mumbled. "Intact," Gerrard reassured her, "which is more than I can say for you, my friend." Sisay laughed despite the pain.

card.name: Furnace Brood
card.ability: {R}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.
card.flavor: Furnace air crackles with magmatic cackles.

card.name: Gallantry
card.ability: Target blocking creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.\nDraw a card.
card.flavor: "Forgive me," Mirri whispered. "I thought you a burden, and you saved my life." Hanna quietly accepted the apology.

card.name: Gaseous Form
card.ability: Enchant creature\nPrevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
card.flavor:
"It's hard to hurt anyone when you're as transparent as your motives."
—Ertai, wizard adept

card.name: Gerrard's Battle Cry
card.ability: {2}{W}: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Gerrard grinned and drew his sword. "This won't be a fair fight," he called to his crew. "They should have brought a second ship!"

card.name: Goblin Bombardment
card.ability: Sacrifice a creature: Goblin Bombardment deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: One mogg to aim the catapult, one mogg to steer the rock.

card.name: Gravedigger
card.ability: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.
card.ruling: \n10/1/2009 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Grindstone
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If both cards share a color, repeat this process.
card.flavor:
"Memory is a burden that wears at the soul as weather wears at stone."
—Crovax
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : If the two cards are both colorless, then the effect does not repeat. It only repeats if both cards have at least one color and at least one color is shared between them. \n10/4/2004 : The effect repeats as many times as it takes to meet the end condition.

card.name: Hammerhead Shark
card.ability: Hammerhead Shark can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
card.flavor: Cross the eyes of a hammerhead and you'll dot its teeth.

card.name: Harrow
card.ability: As an additional cost to cast Harrow, sacrifice a land.\nSearch your library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Changing Rath's landscape is like tearing the scab from a wound.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The sacrifice of a land is part of the cost of casting Harrow. You can't pay this cost more than once to get a multiple effect. 
10/4/2004 : The two lands do not count toward your normal one land you can play each turn. 
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Heartwood Dryad
card.ability: Heartwood Dryad can block creatures with shadow as though Heartwood Dryad had shadow.
card.flavor: To snare what lies between worlds takes the patient reach of trees.

card.name: Heartwood Giant
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Heartwood Giant deals 2 damage to target player.
card.flavor: Wind in the trees is soothing, but the same can't be said for trees on the wind.

card.name: Hermit Druid
card.ability: {G}, {T}: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a basic land card. Put that card into your hand and all other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.
card.flavor: Seeking the company of plants ensures that your wits will go to seed.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : You can put the cards from your library into your graveyard in any order.

card.name: Hibernation Sliver
card.ability: All Slivers have "Pay 2 life: Return this permanent to its owner's hand."
card.flavor: Mogglings have been known to play ball with hibernating slivers, completely unaware of their true nature.
card.ruling: \n7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit. \n7/1/2013 : If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

card.name: Horned Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures have trample.
card.flavor: A bristling wave of slivers broke against the Weatherlight's timbers.
card.ruling: \n7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit. \n7/1/2013 : If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

card.name: Horned Turtle
card.flavor:
"So like men are they: a hardened shell with fragile flesh beneath."
—Selenia, dark angel

card.name: Humility
card.ability: All creatures lose all abilities and have base power and toughness 1/1.
card.flavor:
"One cannot cleanse the wounds of failure."
—Karn, silver golem
card.ruling:
2/1/2006 : With a Humility and two Opalescences on the battlefield, if Humility has the latest timestamp, then all creatures are 1/1 with no abilities. If the timestamp order is Opalescence, Humility, Opalescence, the second Opalescence is 1/1, and the Humility and first Opalescence are 4/4. If Humility has the earliest timestamp, then everything is 4/4. 
2/1/2007 : Removes all creature abilities. This includes mana abilities. Animated lands will also lose the ability to tap for mana. 
10/1/2009 : This is the current interaction between Humility and Opalescence: The type-changing effect applies at layer 4, but the rest happens in the applicable layers. The rest of it will apply even if the permanent loses its ability before it's finished applying. So if Opalescence, Humility, and Worship are on the battlefield and Opalescence entered the battlefield before Humility, the following is true: Layer 4: Humility and Worship each become creatures that are still enchantments. (Opalescence). Layer 6: Humility and Worship each lose their abilities. (Humility) Layer 7b: Humility becomes 4/4 and Worship becomes 4/4. (Opalescence). Humility becomes 1/1 and Worship becomes 1/1 (Humility). But if Humility entered the battlefield before Opalescence, the following is true: Layer 4: Humility and Worship each become creatures that are still enchantments (Opalescence). Layer 6: Humility and Worship each lose their abilities (Humility). Layer 7b: Humility becomes 1/1 and Worship becomes 1/1 (Humility). Humility becomes 4/4 and Worship becomes 4/4 (Opalescence). 
10/1/2009 : You apply power/toughness changing effects in a series of sublayers in the following order: (a) effects from characteristic-defining abilities; (b) effects that set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (c) effects that modify power and/or toughness but don't set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (d) changes from counters; (e) effects that switch a creature's power and toughness. This card's effect is always applied in (b), which means that effects applied in sublayer (c), (d), or (e) will not be overwritten; they will be applied to the new value.

card.name: Intuition
card.ability: Search your library for three cards and reveal them. Target opponent chooses one. Put that card into your hand and the rest into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: \n7/15/2006 : Targets an opponent. You choose an opponent during announcement. If you can't target an opponent, you can't cast this card.

card.name: Jinxed Idol
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, Jinxed Idol deals 2 damage to you.\nSacrifice a creature: Target opponent gains control of Jinxed Idol.
card.flavor: "Here."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Your opponent can use the ability to give this card back to you. 
8/15/2010 : The control-change effect has no duration. The targeted player retains control of Jinxed Idol until the game ends, Jinxed Idol leaves the battlefield, or an effect causes someone else to gain control of it (perhaps because Jinxed Idol's ability is activated again). 
8/15/2010 : If you sacrifice an attacking or blocking creature during the declare blockers step, it won't deal combat damage. If you wait until the combat damage step, but that creature is dealt lethal damage, it'll be destroyed before you get a chance to sacrifice it.

card.name: Kezzerdrix
card.ability: First strike\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, if your opponents control no creatures, Kezzerdrix deals 4 damage to you.

card.name: Killer Whale
card.ability: {U}: Killer Whale gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: Hunger is like the sea: deep, endless, and unforgiving.

card.name: Kindle
card.ability: Kindle deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is 2 plus the number of cards named Kindle in all graveyards.
card.flavor: Hope of deliverance is scorched by the fire of futility.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : Counts the Kindles in graveyard on resolution.

card.name: Kor Chant
card.ability: All damage that would be dealt this turn to target creature you control by a source of your choice is dealt to another target creature instead.
card.flavor: The true treasure no thief can touch.

card.name: Krakilin
card.ability: Krakilin enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.\n{1}{G}: Regenerate Krakilin.
card.flavor:
"A perfect reflection of its world: brutal, fetal, and lacking truth."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Lab Rats
card.ability: Buyback {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nPut a 1/1 black Rat creature token onto the battlefield.

card.name: Legacy's Allure
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a treasure counter on Legacy's Allure.\nSacrifice Legacy's Allure: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to the number of treasure counters on Legacy's Allure. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : The "power less than or equal to the number of treasure counters on this card" restriction is a targeting restriction and will be checked on resolution in addition to on announcement. If the creature's power changes to be greater than this before the effect resolves, then the Legacy's Allure triggered ability is countered, but the card stays in the graveyard.

card.name: Legerdemain
card.ability: Exchange control of target artifact or creature and another target permanent that shares one of those types with it. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.flavor: Squee tucked the warm ball in his pocket and slipped a pebble in its place. "Glok," he mumbled, and hid.
card.ruling: \n4/1/2008 : You can't cast Legerdemain unless both targets share a type at that time. It will also check to make sure they share a type as it resolves. If they no longer do so, the exchange will not occur.

card.name: Lightning Blast
card.ability: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"Those who fear the darkness have never seen what the light can do."
—Selenia, dark angel

card.name: Living Death
card.ability: Each player exiles all creature cards from his or her graveyard, then sacrifices all creatures he or she controls, then puts all cards he or she exiled this way onto the battlefield.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The creatures which are sacrificed can't be regenerated. 
10/4/2004 : Both players exile their creature cards at once. Then both players sacrifice all creatures they control at once. Then both players put all creatures they exiled onto the battlefield. If there are any choices involved for a given step, the current player makes their choices first, then the other player, and finally you do the action all at once. 
9/20/2013 : "All cards he or she exiled this way" refers only to the cards exiled in the first part of the effect. If a replacement effect (such as Leyline of the Void) exiles any of the sacrificed creatures instead of putting them into the graveyard, those cards aren't returned to the battlefield.

card.name: Lotus Petal
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Lotus Petal: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "Hard to imagine," mused Hanna, stroking the petal, "such a lovely flower inspiring such greed."

card.name: Lowland Basilisk
card.ability: Whenever Lowland Basilisk deals damage to a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
card.flavor: Unlike their cousins, Rathi basilisks turn their victims into puddles of flowstone.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : If a creature leaves the battlefield before the end of combat, then the Lowland Basilisk effect on it will end. \n10/4/2004 : If it damages a creature outside of combat, its effect will destroy the creature at the end of the next combat.

card.name: Lowland Giant
card.flavor: "Faugh!" snorted Tahngarth. "Why would it make a meal of something like you?" Squee looked relieved. "No," he continued, "you'd make a much better toothpick."

card.name: Mage il-Vec
card.ability: {T}, Discard a card at random: Mage il-Vec deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Living below a flowstone foundry produces a disproportionate number of fire mages among the il.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : You must discard a card as part of the activation cost. You can't announce the ability unless you have a card in hand.

card.name: Magmasaur
card.ability: Magmasaur enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a +1/+1 counter from Magmasaur. If you don't, sacrifice Magmasaur and it deals damage equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on it to each creature without flying and each player.

card.name: Mana Leak
card.ability: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
card.flavor:
"The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy."
—Volrath

card.name: Manabond
card.ability: At the beginning of your end step, you may reveal your hand and put all land cards from it onto the battlefield. If you do, discard your hand.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The lands are put onto the battlefield during the resolution of the ability. 
10/4/2004 : You discard all the cards still in your hand after you put the lands onto the battlefield. 
10/4/2004 : Putting a land onto the battlefield does not count as playing a land.

card.name: Maniacal Rage
card.ability: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.
card.flavor: Only by sacrificing any semblance of defense could Gerrard best Greven.

card.name: Master Decoy
card.ability: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
card.flavor:
"A skilled decoy can throw your enemies off your trail. A master decoy can survive to do it again."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

card.name: Mawcor
card.ability: Flying\n{T}: Mawcor deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: From its maw comes neither word nor whisper—only wind.

card.name: Maze of Shadows
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Untap target attacking creature with shadow. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.

card.name: Meditate
card.ability: Draw four cards. You skip your next turn.
card.flavor:
"Part of me believes that Barrin taught me meditation simply to shut me up."
—Ertai, wizard adept
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : You skip one turn as part of the effect.

card.name: Merfolk Looter
card.ability: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
card.flavor: In the depths of Rootwater, salvage and sewage differ only in texture.

card.name: Metallic Sliver
card.flavor: When the clever counterfeit was accepted by the hive, Volrath's influence upon the slivers grew even stronger.
card.ruling: \n7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit. \n7/1/2013 : If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

card.name: Mindless Automaton
card.ability: Mindless Automaton enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.\n{1}, Discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on Mindless Automaton.\nRemove two +1/+1 counters from Mindless Automaton: Draw a card.

card.name: Mirri, Cat Warrior
card.ability: First strike, forestwalk, vigilance (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike, it can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
card.flavor:
"Full of beauty and grace, with a predator's instincts . . . Although she wanders, I have always thought Mirri belongs in Llanowar most of all."
—Rofellos, Llanowar emissary

card.name: Mnemonic Sliver
card.ability: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: Draw a card."
card.flavor:
"A jigsaw puzzle that lives, breeds, and thinks."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator
card.ruling: \n7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit. \n7/1/2013 : If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

card.name: Mogg Conscripts
card.ability: Mogg Conscripts can't attack unless you've cast a creature spell this turn.
card.flavor:
"Torahn's horns! They've seen us. Now, statue, you must fight to save yourself!"
—Tahngarth, aboard the Predator
card.ruling: \n4/1/2008 : A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

card.name: Mogg Fanatic
card.ability: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: Mogg Fanatic deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: "I got it! I got it! I—"

card.name: Mogg Flunkies
card.ability: Mogg Flunkies can't attack or block alone.
card.flavor: They'll attack whatever's in front of them—as long as you tell them where that is.
card.ruling:
7/1/2012 : Mogg Flunkies can be declared as an attacker only if another creature is declared as an attacker at the same time. Similarly, Mogg Flunkies can be declared as a blocker only if another creature is declared as a blocker at the same time. 
7/1/2012 : Two or more Mogg Flunkies can attack or block together. 
7/1/2012 : Although Mogg Flunkies can't attack alone, the other attacking creature(s) doesn't have to attack the same player or planeswalker. For example, Mogg Flunkies could attack an opponent and another creature could attack a planeswalker that opponent controls. 
7/1/2012 : In a Two-Headed Giant game (or in another format using the shared team turns option), Mogg Flunkies can attack or block with a creature controlled by your teammate, even if no other creatures you control are attacking or blocking.

card.name: Mogg Hollows
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool. Mogg Hollows doesn't untap during your next untap step.

card.name: Mogg Infestation
card.ability: Destroy all creatures target player controls. For each creature that died this way, put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield under that player's control.

card.name: Mogg Maniac
card.ability: Whenever Mogg Maniac is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to target opponent.
card.flavor: Stand clear if he gets an itch.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : If it blocks a trample creature, it only gets dealt damage equal to what is assigned to it. This means it will likely only get to deal 1 damage to the opponent.

card.name: Mounted Archers
card.ability: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)\n{W}: Mounted Archers can block an additional creature this turn.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : You can use the ability multiple times so it can block more than two creatures. \n4/1/2008 : This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

card.name: Mox Diamond
card.ability: If Mox Diamond would enter the battlefield, you may discard a land card instead. If you do, put Mox Diamond onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.\n{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.ruling: \n5/1/2008 : If you don't discard a land card, Mox Diamond never enters the battlefield. It won't trigger abilities that look for something entering the battlefield, and you won't get the opportunity to tap it for mana.

card.name: Mulch
card.ability: Reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all land cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
card.flavor: Hope is the one crop that can grow in any climate.

card.name: Muscle Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures get +1/+1.
card.flavor: The air was filled with the cracks and snaps of flesh hardening as the new sliver joined the battle.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Yes, it does give the +1/+1 bonus to itself. 
7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit. 
7/1/2013 : If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

card.name: Necrologia
card.ability: Cast Necrologia only during your end step.\nAs an additional cost to cast Necrologia, pay X life.\nDraw X cards.
card.flavor:
"My enemies' death yields threefold benefit: removal, reuse, and research."
—Volrath
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : This spell is cast during the End step. Since you discard down to 7 cards in the cleanup step, this card is used before the discard.

card.name: Needle Storm
card.ability: Needle Storm deals 4 damage to each creature with flying.
card.flavor: The rain is driven like nails.

card.name: Nomads en-Kor
card.ability: {0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Nomads en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.
card.flavor: The kor forsake roots for the winding of the path, forsake voices for the silence of the mind, forsake all else for the poverty of isolation.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability of this card does not do anything to stop Trample damage from being assigned to the defending player. 
10/4/2004 : It can redirect damage to itself. 
10/4/2004 : It is possible to redirect more damage to a creature than that creature's toughness. 
10/4/2004 : You can use this ability as much as you want prior to damage being dealt. 
7/1/2013 : When you redirect combat damage it is still combat damage.

card.name: Oath of Druids
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses target player who controls more creatures than he or she does and is his or her opponent. The first player may reveal cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. If he or she does, that player puts that card onto the battlefield and all other cards revealed this way into his or her graveyard.
card.ruling: \n10/1/2009 : The ability can only target an opponent of the current player. \n10/1/2009 : The targeted player controlling more creatures than the current player is a part of the targeting requirement. A player can't be targeted by this ability unless it's true, and the ability will be countered on resolution if it's no longer true at that time.

card.name: Ogre Shaman
card.ability: {2}, Discard a card at random: Ogre Shaman deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Ogre shamans must be bright enough to learn their invocations and dim enough to use them.

card.name: Orim, Samite Healer
card.ability: {T}: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
card.flavor:
"The silkworm spins itself a new existence. So the healer weaves the threads of life."
—Orim, Samite healer

card.name: Overrun
card.ability: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"You want to know your enemy? Look at your feet while you trample him."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight
card.ruling: \n10/1/2009 : Overrun affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.

card.name: Pacifism
card.ability: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature can't attack or block.
card.flavor: Frozen by conscience, Karn did not resist as the moggs carried him to the Predator.

card.name: Paladin en-Vec
card.ability: First strike, protection from black and from red (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike. It can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black or red.)
card.flavor: "Our belief shall be the lance that pierces Volrath's heart."

card.name: Pandemonium
card.ability: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, that creature's controller may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature or player of his or her choice.
card.flavor:
"If we cannot live proudly, we die so!"
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : The triggered ability does not check the creature's power until the ability resolves. If the creature is not on the battlefield when the ability resolves, it does damage equal to the power of the creature right before it left the battlefield. This means that if a creature enters the battlefield which can destroy itself as a "enters the battlefield" ability, the order of resolution of the triggered abilities does not matter. \n9/25/2006 : If player A controls Pandemonium when a creature enters the battlefield under player B's control, player A controls the triggered ability even though player B chooses the target and chooses whether to have the creature deal damage, which could be important if multiple abilities controlled by multiple players trigger.

card.name: Patchwork Gnomes
card.ability: Discard a card: Regenerate Patchwork Gnomes.
card.flavor:
"Just when I get them working, they always start fighting and tearing at each other for spare parts."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

card.name: Pegasus Stampede
card.ability: Buyback—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nPut a 1/1 white Pegasus creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

card.name: Phyrexian Hulk
card.flavor:
"They are convenient in having no souls, but less so in having no spirit."
—Volrath

card.name: Pine Barrens
card.ability: Pine Barrens enters the battlefield tapped.\n{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool. Pine Barrens deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Provoke
card.ability: Untap target creature you don't control. That creature blocks this turn if able.\nDraw a card.
card.flavor: Mirri did not have time to think, only to react.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : You can target an untapped creature.

card.name: Rampant Growth
card.ability: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Rath forces plants from its surface as one presses whey from cheese.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect. \n10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Rathi Dragon
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\nWhen Rathi Dragon enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice two Mountains.
card.flavor:
Wrap the flame as twine,
Kingdoms will be thine.

card.name: Rats of Rath
card.ability: {B}: Destroy target artifact, creature, or land you control.
card.flavor:
"These creatures offer new challenges in the scrutiny of entrails."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Reality Anchor
card.ability: Target creature loses shadow until end of turn.\nDraw a card.
card.flavor:
"See how you like it."
—Ertai, wizard adept

card.name: Reanimate
card.ability: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.
card.flavor:
"You will learn to earn death."
—Volrath
card.ruling: \n12/1/2004 : You lose life equal to the converted mana cost of the card you're bringing back, so if you Reanimate Volrath's Shapeshifter, you lose three life, regardless of what the next card down is.

card.name: Recurring Nightmare
card.ability: Sacrifice a creature, Return Recurring Nightmare to its owner's hand: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
card.flavor:
"I am confined by sleep and defined by nightmare."
—Crovax
card.ruling: \n4/15/2013 : If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you'll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

card.name: Recycle
card.ability: Skip your draw step.\nWhenever you play a card, draw a card.\nYour maximum hand size is two.
card.ruling:
2/1/2007 : Your maximum hand size is checked only during the cleanup step of your turn. At any other time, you may have any number of cards in hand. 
2/1/2007 : Countering a spell that has been cast will not prevent you from drawing the card. 
10/1/2009 : If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Spellbook (an artifact that says you have no maximum hand size) onto the battlefield and then put Recycle onto the battlefield, your maximum hand size will be two. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, you would have no maximum hand size.

card.name: Renegade Warlord
card.ability: First strike\nWhenever Renegade Warlord attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"His tongue must be honey, the way he gathers ants to fight with him."
—Volrath

card.name: Repentance
card.ability: Target creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.
card.flavor:
"The cannon wasn't aimed at you!" pleaded Vhati.
"I'm not sure which is more pathetic," replied Greven, "your judgment or your aim."

card.name: Revenant
card.ability: Flying\nRevenant's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
card.flavor:
"Not again."
—Hans

card.name: Rolling Thunder
card.ability: Rolling Thunder deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
card.flavor: "Such rage," thought Vhati, gazing up at the thunderhead from the Predator. "It is Greven's mind manifest."
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : X can be zero. \n10/4/2004 : If X is greater than zero, you can't choose zero targets. You must choose between 1 and X targets. If X is zero, you can't choose any targets.

card.name: Rootbreaker Wurm
card.ability: Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
card.flavor: As Gerrard made his escape, the wurm covered his flight by helping itself to three great mouthfuls of merfolk.

card.name: Rootwalla
card.ability: {1}{G}: Rootwalla gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor: If you try to sneak up on a rootwalla, you'll suddenly find yourself dealing with twice the lizard.
card.ruling: \n2/1/2006 : If this card's ability is activated by one player, then another player takes control of it on the same turn, the second player can't activate its ability that turn.

card.name: Rootwater Depths
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool. Rootwater Depths doesn't untap during your next untap step.

card.name: Rootwater Hunter
card.ability: {T}: Rootwater Hunter deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"Bitter water, vicious wave;
Shadow-cold shallows, root-made maze.
Home's angry embrace."
—Rootwater Saga

card.name: Sabertooth Wyvern
card.ability: Flying, first strike
card.flavor: Most creatures grow out of their baby teeth, but sabertooth wyverns grow into theirs.

card.name: Salt Flats
card.ability: Salt Flats enters the battlefield tapped.\n{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool. Salt Flats deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Sandstone Warrior
card.ability: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)\n{R}: Sandstone Warrior gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"I used to describe something stable as ‘rock solid.' So much for that expression."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

card.name: Sarcomancy
card.ability: When Sarcomancy enters the battlefield, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no Zombies on the battlefield, Sarcomancy deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Scabland
card.ability: Scabland enters the battlefield tapped.\n{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool. Scabland deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Screeching Harpy
card.ability: Flying\n{1}{B}: Regenerate Screeching Harpy.
card.flavor:
"They are called ‘fowl' for a reason."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

card.name: Scrivener
card.ability: When Scrivener enters the battlefield, you may return target instant card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor:
"History is a potent weapon."
—Karn, silver golem

card.name: Sea Monster
card.ability: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
card.flavor: Water is life. Or perhaps it is just something to wash it down with.

card.name: Searing Touch
card.ability: Buyback {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nSearing Touch deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Seething Anger
card.ability: Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nTarget creature gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Selenia, Dark Angel
card.ability: Flying\nPay 2 life: Return Selenia, Dark Angel to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: "I am light. I am dark. I must give my life to serve; not even death can release me."

card.name: Serpent Warrior
card.ability: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
card.flavor: A hiss before dying.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : You can cast this if you have less than 3 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

card.name: Shackles
card.ability: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.\n{W}: Return Shackles to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Shackles of gold are still shackles.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : Shackles does not tap the creature when it enters the battlefield.

card.name: Shadow Rift
card.ability: Target creature gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\nDraw a card.

card.name: Shadowstorm
card.ability: Shadowstorm deals 2 damage to each creature with shadow.
card.flavor:
"You've not seen a storm until you've seen the kind that roars between worlds."
—Lyna, soltari emissary

card.name: Shaman en-Kor
card.ability: {0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Shaman en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.\n{1}{W}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that damage is dealt to Shaman en-Kor instead.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability of this card does not do anything to stop Trample damage from being assigned to the defending player. 
10/4/2004 : It can redirect damage to itself. 
10/4/2004 : It is possible to redirect more damage to a creature than that creature's toughness. 
10/4/2004 : You can use this ability as much as you want prior to damage being dealt. 
7/1/2013 : When you redirect combat damage it is still combat damage.

card.name: Shard Phoenix
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\nSacrifice Shard Phoenix: Shard Phoenix deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.\n{R}{R}{R}: Return Shard Phoenix from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
card.ruling: \n8/1/2005 : You can return Shard Phoenix any time during your upkeep; this is not a beginning of upkeep triggered ability. \n8/1/2005 : Shard Phoenix uses Last Known Information. If, for example, it was blue when it was sacrificed, the damage will come from a blue source.

card.name: Shatter
card.ability: Destroy target artifact.
card.flavor:
"Such fuss over machines, Gerrard. Remember that you are the prize of the Legacy. Throw away your toys!"
—Orim, Samite healer
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : Regenerating artifacts can regenerate from this.

card.name: Sift
card.ability: Draw three cards, then discard a card.
card.flavor:
"Twice I have let the Legacy slip away. Never again."
—Karn, silver golem

card.name: Silver Wyvern
card.ability: Flying\n{U}: Change the target of target spell or ability that targets only Silver Wyvern. The new target must be a creature.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : You must pick a legal target when redirecting the spell or ability.

card.name: Skyshaper
card.ability: Sacrifice Skyshaper: Creatures you control gain flying until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"It'll get us to the portal, but I can't guarantee what it'll do to the ship."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

card.name: Skyshroud Elf
card.ability: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.\n{1}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"It is our duty to endure."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

card.name: Skyshroud Forest
card.ability: Skyshroud Forest enters the battlefield tapped.\n{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool. Skyshroud Forest deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Skyshroud Troll
card.ability: {1}{G}: Regenerate Skyshroud Troll.
card.flavor: The elves and merfolk have nothing but bitterness for each other. The trolls, however, find them both rather tasty.

card.name: Skyshroud Vampire
card.ability: Flying\nDiscard a creature card: Skyshroud Vampire gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"If it tastes one drop of elvish blood I will cast it from the shroud to see it burn."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

card.name: Sliver Queen
card.ability: {2}: Put a 1/1 colorless Sliver creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: Her children are ever part of her.

card.name: Smite
card.ability: Destroy target blocked creature.
card.flavor:
"You've got your childhood wish at last. Now you get to die."
—Gerrard, to Volrath
card.ruling: \n6/15/2010 : A "blocked creature" is an attacking creature that has been blocked by a creature this combat, or has become blocked as the result of a spell or ability this combat. Unless the attacking creature leaves combat, it continues to be a blocked creature through the end of combat step, even if the creature or creatures that blocked it are no longer on the battlefield or have otherwise left combat by then.

card.name: Soltari Champion
card.ability: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\nWhenever Soltari Champion attacks, other creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Soltari Guerrillas
card.ability: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\n{0}: The next time Soltari Guerrillas would deal combat damage to an opponent this turn, it deals that damage to target creature instead.
card.ruling: \n8/1/2008 : Regardless of when the ability is activated, it will apply to the defending player at the time Soltari Guerrillas tries to deal combat damage to him or her.

card.name: Soltari Lancer
card.ability: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\nSoltari Lancer has first strike as long as it's attacking.
card.flavor:
"In times of war the victors rarely save their best for last."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
card.ruling: \n4/1/2008 : For a time, the ability that granted it first strike was a triggered ability. It has been restored to a static ability that applies continuously while the Lancer is attacking. There is never a time when the Lancer is attacking but doesn't have first strike.

card.name: Soltari Monk
card.ability: Protection from black\nShadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
card.flavor:
"Prayer rarely explains."
—Orim, Samite healer

card.name: Soltari Priest
card.ability: Protection from red\nShadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
card.flavor: "In Rath," the priest said, "there is even greater need for prayer."

card.name: Soltari Trooper
card.ability: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\nWhenever Soltari Trooper attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Dauthi blood is soltari wine."
—Soltari Tales of Life

card.name: Spell Blast
card.ability: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X. (For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)
card.flavor: Call it the thinking mage's version of brute force.
card.ruling: \n7/1/2013 : Alternative costs, additional costs, cost increases, and cost reductions don’t affect a spell’s converted mana cost. \n7/1/2013 : If the target spell has {X} in its converted mana cost, include the value chosen for that X when determining the value of the {X} in Spell Blast’s mana cost. For example, if you wish to counter Volcanic Geyser (a spell with mana cost {X}{R}{R}) whose X is 7, you’ll need to choose 9 for Spell Blast’s X and pay {9}{U}.

card.name: Spellshock
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a spell, Spellshock deals 2 damage to that player.
card.flavor: A snap of fingers, a snap of teeth.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : It affects all players, including you.

card.name: Spike Breeder
card.ability: Spike Breeder enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.\n{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Breeder: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.\n{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Breeder: Put a 1/1 green Spike creature token onto the battlefield.

card.name: Spike Colony
card.ability: Spike Colony enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.\n{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Colony: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

card.name: Spike Feeder
card.ability: Spike Feeder enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.\n{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Feeder: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.\nRemove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Feeder: You gain 2 life.

card.name: Spike Hatcher
card.ability: Spike Hatcher enters the battlefield with six +1/+1 counters on it.\n{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Hatcher: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.\n{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Hatcher: Regenerate Spike Hatcher.

card.name: Spinal Graft
card.ability: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +3/+3.\nWhen enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.

card.name: Spined Sliver
card.ability: Whenever a Sliver becomes blocked, that Sliver gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
card.flavor:
"Slivers are evil and slivers are sly;
And if you get eaten, then no one will cry."
—Mogg children's rhyme
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If two Spined Slivers are on the battlefield then each blocked sliver gets +2/+2 for each creature blocking it. 
7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit. 
7/1/2013 : If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

card.name: Spined Wurm
card.flavor:
"As it moved, the wurm's spines gathered up bits of flowstone, which took the shapes of dead villagers' heads. Each head spoke a single sound, but if taken together, they said, ‘Alas for the living.'"
—Dal myth of the wurm

card.name: Spirit en-Kor
card.ability: Flying\n{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Spirit en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.
card.flavor:
Death free throat from thirst, mouth from speech, feet from earth.
—Kor requiem
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability of this card does not do anything to stop Trample damage from being assigned to the defending player. 
10/4/2004 : It can redirect damage to itself. 
10/4/2004 : It is possible to redirect more damage to a creature than that creature's toughness. 
10/4/2004 : You can use this ability as much as you want prior to damage being dealt. 
7/1/2013 : When you redirect combat damage it is still combat damage.

card.name: Spirit Mirror
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no Reflection tokens on the battlefield, put a 2/2 white Reflection creature token onto the battlefield.\n{0}: Destroy target Reflection.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : It checks if there are any Reflection tokens on the battlefield at the beginning of upkeep, and if there are it will not trigger at all. It will check again on resolution and will do nothing if a Reflection is on the battlefield at that time.

card.name: Spitting Hydra
card.ability: Spitting Hydra enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.\n{1}{R}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spitting Hydra: Spitting Hydra deals 1 damage to target creature.

card.name: Stalking Stones
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{6}: Stalking Stones becomes a 3/3 Elemental artifact creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.ruling: \n8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature. \n10/1/2009 : Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

card.name: Standing Troops
card.ability: Vigilance
card.flavor: The less you have, the harder you fight for it.

card.name: Starke of Rath
card.ability: {T}: Destroy target artifact or creature. That permanent's controller gains control of Starke of Rath. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.flavor:
"I know to whom I owe the most loyalty, and I see him in the mirror every day."
—Starke

card.name: Staunch Defenders
card.ability: When Staunch Defenders enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
card.flavor:
"Hold your position! Leave doubt for the dying!"
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

card.name: Stronghold Assassin
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonblack creature.
card.flavor: The assassin sees only throats and hears only heartbeats.

card.name: Stun
card.ability: Target creature can't block this turn.\nDraw a card.
card.flavor:
"I concede it was a cheap shot, but it was the only one I could afford."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : Must be used before blockers are declared in order to affect blocking decisions. You can't wait to see what your opponent declares and then try to stop them. \n10/4/2004 : You can use it after combat or even on a creature which can't possibly block this turn because it's that player's turn to attack, but it generally has no effect other than to let you draw a card.

card.name: Survival of the Fittest
card.ability: {G}, Discard a creature card: Search your library for a creature card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Telethopter
card.ability: Tap an untapped creature you control: Telethopter gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: After losing several of the devices to midair collisions, Greven forbade moggs from operating telethopters.

card.name: Thalakos Drifters
card.ability: Discard a card: Thalakos Drifters gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
card.flavor: They drift in and out of shadow and ever on toward madness.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : The reminder text is only accurate when this card has Shadow.

card.name: Thalakos Lowlands
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool. Thalakos Lowlands doesn't untap during your next untap step.

card.name: Thalakos Scout
card.ability: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\nDiscard a card: Return Thalakos Scout to its owner's hand.

card.name: Thalakos Seer
card.ability: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\nWhen Thalakos Seer leaves the battlefield, draw a card.
card.flavor:
"You see our world when you shut your eyes so tightly that tiny shapes float before them."
—Lyna, to Ertai

card.name: Thopter Squadron
card.ability:
Flying
Thopter Squadron enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Thopter Squadron: Put a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
{1}, Sacrifice another Thopter: Put a +1/+1 counter on Thopter Squadron. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

card.name: Thrull Surgeon
card.ability: {1}{B}, Sacrifice Thrull Surgeon: Look at target player's hand and choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
card.flavor: "Just take a little off the top."

card.name: Time Ebb
card.ability: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
card.flavor:
"Gone today, here tomorrow."
—Ertai, wizard adept

card.name: Time Warp
card.ability: Target player takes an extra turn after this one.
card.flavor:
"Let's do it again!"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

card.name: Tradewind Rider
card.ability: Flying\n{T}, Tap two untapped creatures you control: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: It is said that the wind will blow the world past if you wait long enough.

card.name: Trained Armodon
card.flavor: These are its last days. Better to grow broad and heavy. Better that the enemy is crushed beneath its carcass.

card.name: Tranquility
card.ability: Destroy all enchantments.
card.flavor:
"Peace will come, but whether born of harmony or entropy I cannot say."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Twitch
card.ability: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.\nDraw a card.
card.flavor: Battles are won in nuance.
card.ruling: \n3/1/2010 : If the targeted permanent is an illegal target by the time Twitch resolves, the entire spell is countered. You don't draw a card.

card.name: Vampire Hounds
card.ability: Discard a creature card: Vampire Hounds gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The hounds' barks are a horrifying chorus of screams, moans, and whispers.

card.name: Vec Townships
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool. Vec Townships doesn't untap during your next untap step.

card.name: Verdant Force
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor:
Burl, scurf, and bower
Birth fern and flower.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Verdant Force's controller gets the tokens. That is the controller at the beginning of upkeep. 
8/1/2005 : Once created, the tokens are independent of Verdant Force. If Verdant Force changes controllers, the new controller will put tokens onto the battlefield, but existing tokens will stay where they are. 
5/1/2006 : In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.

card.name: Verdant Touch
card.ability: Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nTarget land becomes a 2/2 creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
