card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : The land is still a land and retains all its abilities, plus any other characteristics. \n8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

card.name: Verdigris
card.ability: Destroy target artifact.
card.flavor:
"Only the most sophisticated inventions can survive nature's unsophisticated motivations."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

card.name: Vhati il-Dal
card.ability: {T}: Until end of turn, target creature has base power 1 or base toughness 1.
card.flavor:
"Sir, I just thought . . . ," explained Vhati.
"Don't think," interrupted Greven. "It doesn't suit you."
card.ruling: \n9/25/2006 : You don't choose whether to affect the targeted creature's power or its toughness until the ability resolves. \n10/1/2009 : You apply power/toughness changing effects in a series of sublayers in the following order: (a) effects from characteristic-defining abilities; (b) effects that set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (c) effects that modify power and/or toughness but don't set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (d) changes from counters; (e) effects that switch a creature's power and toughness. This card's effect is always applied in (b), which means that effects applied in sublayer (c), (d), or (e) will not be overwritten; they will be applied to the new value.

card.name: Victual Sliver
card.ability: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: You gain 4 life."
card.flavor: "We are kinfolk," explained Karn to the sliver queen. "Just as you need your progeny to complete you, so do I need the pieces of the Legacy to make me whole."
card.ruling: \n7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit. \n7/1/2013 : If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

card.name: Volrath's Curse
card.ability: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated. That creature's controller may sacrifice a permanent for that player to ignore this effect until end of turn.\n{1}{U}: Return Volrath's Curse to its owner's hand.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : If the creature this card is on is sacrificed to this card, this card is put into the graveyard before the ability to unsummon it can be used. \n7/1/2013 : Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder texts.

card.name: Volrath's Laboratory
card.ability: As Volrath's Laboratory enters the battlefield, choose a color and a creature type.\n{5}, {T}: Put a 2/2 creature token of the chosen color and type onto the battlefield.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : The token has the same name as the creature type. \n10/4/2004 : The token does not have any built-in abilities. For example, choosing creature type Bird does not give the token Flying.

card.name: Volrath's Stronghold
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{1}{B}, {T}: Put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.
card.flavor: The seed of a world's evil.

card.name: Wall of Blossoms
card.ability: Defender\nWhen Wall of Blossoms enters the battlefield, draw a card.
card.flavor: Each flower identical, every leaf and petal disturbingly exact.

card.name: Wall of Diffusion
card.ability: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\nWall of Diffusion can block creatures with shadow as though Wall of Diffusion had shadow.
card.flavor:
"The injury was being caught between this world and our own; the insult was to find walls within."
—Lyna, soltari emissary

card.name: Wall of Essence
card.ability: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\nWhenever Wall of Essence is dealt combat damage, you gain that much life.
card.flavor:
The ceiling and the floor fell in love, but only the wall knew.
—Dal saying
card.ruling: \n7/18/2014 : Wall of Essence’s triggered ability will trigger even if it’s dealt lethal damage. For example, if it’s dealt 7 combat damage, its ability will trigger and you’ll gain 7 life.

card.name: Wall of Souls
card.ability: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\nWhenever Wall of Souls is dealt combat damage, it deals that much damage to target opponent.
card.flavor:
"It is the nature of evil to turn you against yourself."
—Starke
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : Redirected damage is still combat damage, so it will trigger on combat damage that is redirected to it.

card.name: Warrior en-Kor
card.ability: {0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Warrior en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.
card.flavor: Only a matter as vital as destroying Volrath could bring together the reclusive kor people.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability of this card does not do anything to stop Trample damage from being assigned to the defending player. 
10/4/2004 : It can redirect damage to itself. 
10/4/2004 : It is possible to redirect more damage to a creature than that creature's toughness. 
10/4/2004 : You can use this ability as much as you want prior to damage being dealt. 
7/1/2013 : When you redirect combat damage it is still combat damage.

card.name: Wasteland
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{T}, Sacrifice Wasteland: Destroy target nonbasic land.
card.flavor:
"The land promises nothing and keeps its promise."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Wayward Soul
card.ability: Flying\n{U}: Put Wayward Soul on top of its owner's library.
card.flavor:
"No home, no heart, no hope."
—Stronghold graffito

card.name: Whispers of the Muse
card.ability: Buyback {5} (You may pay an additional {5} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nDraw a card.
card.flavor:
"I followed her song only to find it was a dirge."
—Crovax

card.name: Wind Dancer
card.ability: Flying\n{T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Flying like a bird does not make you as free as one."
—Volrath

card.name: Wind Drake
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Orim regarded Gerrard coolly. "You are like the drake," she said, her expression unchanging. "It works hard to maintain its position, but to us it seems to glide along effortlessly. You must do the same."

card.name: Winds of Rath
card.ability: Destroy all creatures that aren't enchanted. They can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"There shall be a vast shout and then a vaster silence."
—Oracle en-Vec
card.ruling: \n8/1/2005 : A creature is "enchanted" if it has any Auras attached to it.

card.name: Winged Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures have flying.
card.flavor:
"Everything around here has cut a deal with gravity."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
card.ruling: \n7/1/2013 : Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit. \n7/1/2013 : If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

card.name: Wood Sage
card.ability: {T}: Name a creature card. Reveal the top four cards of your library and put all of them with that name into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.

card.name: Youthful Knight
card.ability: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
card.flavor:
"Let no child be without a sword. We will all fight, for if we fail, we will certainly all die."
—Oracle en-Vec
